verses.verse: Impending Disaster The word of the LORD came to me:
(Ezek 11.13; Am 8.2; Rev 7.1; 20.8) You, O mortal, thus says the Lord GOD to the land of Israel: An end! The end has come upon the four corners of the land.
Now the end is upon you; I will let loose my anger upon you; I will judge you according to your ways; I will punish you for all your abominations.
(Ezek 5.11; 6.7; 8.18; 11.21) My eye will not spare you; I will have no pity. I will punish you for your ways while your abominations are among you. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.
(2 Kings 21.12, 13) Thus says the Lord GOD: Disaster after disaster! See, it comes.
An end has come; the end has come. It has awakened against you; see, it comes!
(v 12|EZK 7:12; Isa 22.5) Your doom (Meaning of Heb uncertain) has come to you, O inhabitant of the land. The time has come; the day is near— of tumult, not of reveling on the mountains.
(v 3|EZK 7:3; Ezek 6.12; 20.8, 21) Soon now I will pour out my wrath upon you; I will spend my anger against you. I will judge you according to your ways and punish you for all your abominations.
My eye will not spare; I will have no pity. I will punish you according to your ways while your abominations are among you. Then you shall know that it is I the LORD who strike.
See, the day! See, it comes! Your doom (Meaning of Heb uncertain) has gone out. The rod has blossomed; pride has budded.
(Jer 6.7; 16.5, 6; Ezek 24.16, 22) Violence has grown into a rod of wickedness. None of them shall remain, not their abundance, not their wealth; no preeminence among them. (Meaning of Heb uncertain)
The time has come; the day draws near; let not the buyer rejoice nor the seller mourn, for wrath is upon all their multitude.

For the sellers shall not return to what has been sold as long as they remain alive. For the vision concerns all their multitude; it shall not be revoked. Because of their iniquity, they cannot maintain their lives. (Gk: Meaning of Heb uncertain)
They have blown the horn and made everything ready, but no one goes to battle, for my wrath is upon all their multitude.
(Deut 32.25; Ezek 5.12) The sword is outside; pestilence and famine are inside; those in the field die by the sword; those in the city—famine and pestilence devour them.
(Isa 38.14; 59.11; Ezek 6.8; 14.22) If any survivors escape, they shall be found on the mountains like doves of the valleys, all of them moaning over their iniquity.
(Isa 13.7; Ezek 21.7; Heb 12.12) All hands shall grow feeble, all knees turn to water.
(Isa 15.2, 3; Ezek 27.31; Am 8.10) They shall put on sackcloth; horror shall cover them. Shame shall be on all faces, baldness on all their heads.

(Prov 11.4; Isa 30.22; Ezek 13.5; 14.3, 4; Zeph 1.18) They shall fling their silver into the streets; their gold shall be treated as unclean. Their silver and gold cannot save them on the day of the wrath of the LORD. They shall not satisfy their hunger or fill their stomachs with it. For it was the stumbling block of their iniquity.

(Jer 7.30) From their (Syr Symmachus: Heb its) beautiful ornament, in which they took pride, they made their abominable images, their detestable things; therefore I will make of it an unclean thing to them.
(Ps 74.2-8) I will hand it over to strangers as plunder, to the wicked of the earth as spoil; they shall profane it.
(Ezek 39.23, 24) I will avert my face from them so that they may profane my treasured (Or secret) place; the violent shall enter it; they shall profane it.
(2 Kings 21.16; Ezek 8.17; 9.9) Make a chain! (Meaning of Heb uncertain) For the land is full of bloody crimes; the city is full of violence.
(Ezek 21.31; 24.21; 33.28) I will bring the worst of the nations to take possession of their houses. I will put an end to the arrogance of the strong, and their holy places shall be profaned.
(Ezek 13.10, 16) When anguish comes, they will seek peace, but there shall be none.

(Deut 32.23; Ps 74.9; Jer 4.20; Ezek 20.1, 3; 21.7) Disaster comes upon disaster; rumor follows rumor; they shall keep seeking a vision from the prophet; instruction shall perish from the priest and counsel from the elders.

(vv 3, 4, 8|EZK 7:348; Ps 35.26; Ezek 18.20; 26.16) The king shall mourn, the prince shall be wrapped in despair, and the hands of the people of the land shall tremble. According to their way I will deal with them; according to their own judgments I will judge them. And they shall know that I am the LORD.
